Well, you know, what these disparities come down to is a very simple thing.

There really needs to be written a book called ""The New Black History."" And whatever you think about these disparities, there is a guiding notion in a lot of people's mind that if you could roll the tape back to 1986, what happened is that a bunch of overweight, suburban, barbequing, middle-aged white people cooked up some laws to get as many black men into prison as possible by making crack cocaine more prosecutable than powdered cocaine.

If you did roll the tape back, what you would see is people of the Maxine Waters-type, concerned black people who were every bit as much behind that legislation and in some cases more than the white people -many of whom really didn't care.

is saying, I think - I'm not saying that it's totally a myth that this was cooked up as a conspiracy against black men.

People were afraid, so they said, okay, here, just do whatever it takes to secure the nation.
